author: Staff Reporter
text:
Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (MDMK), Puducherry unit executive committee has demanded the Puducherry government to take immediate measures to bring back the Karaikal fishermen detained by the Sri Lankan Navy.

The executive committee met under A. Chandrasekaran on Sunday and stressed for recruitment of youth for posts of government teachers and higher division clerical staff.

In a press release, the MDMK leader stated that many youngsters had written the exams for this post and waiting for the result to be announced.

The government should make speedy arrangements for their recruitment. They also demanded that those completing MBBS in Puducherry Medical Colleges should be recruited to fill the vacancies in the Puducherry government hospitals.
title: MDMK urges govt. to take measures to bring back Karaikal fishermen
